h1201.definition: from an unused root meaning to stink; offensiveness; Basha, a king of Israel; Baasha.

h1202.definition: from {{h6213}} and {{h3050}} with a prepositional prefix; in (the) work of Jah; Baasejah, an Israelite; Baaseiah.

h1203.definition: from {{h6251}} (as singular of {{h6252}}) with a prepositional prefix; with Ashtoreth; Beeshterah, a place East of the Jordan; Beeshterah.

h1204.definition: a primitive root; to fear; affright, be (make) afraid, terrify, trouble.

h1206.definition: probably the same as {{h948}}; mud (as whitish clay); mire.

h1207.definition: intensive from {{h1206}}; a swamp; fen, mire(-ry place).

h1208.definition: from {{h1219}}; inaccessible, i.e. lofty; vintage (by confusion with {{h1210}}).

h1209.definition: perhaps the same as {{h1153}}; Betsai, the name of two Israelites; Bezai.

h1210.definition: from {{h1219}}; clipped, i.e. the grape crop; vintage.

h1211.definition: from an unused root apparently meaning to peel; an onion; onion.

h1212.definition: probably from {{h6738}} and {{h410}} with a prepositional prefix; in (the) shadow (i.e. protection) of God; Betsalel, the name of two Israelites; Bezaleel.

h1213.definition: or בַּצְלִית; from the same as {{h1211}}; a peeling; Batsluth or Batslith, an Israelite; Bazlith, Bazluth.

h1214.definition: a primitive root; to break off, i.e. (usually) plunder; figuratively, to finish, or (intransitively) stop; (be) covet(-ous), cut (off), finish, fulfill, gain (greedily), get, be given to (covetousness), greedy, perform, be wounded.

h1215.definition: from {{h1214}}; plunder; by extension, gain (usually unjust); covetousness, (dishonest) gain, lucre, profit.

h1216.definition: a primitive root; perhaps to swell up, i.e. blister; swell.

h1217.definition: from {{h1216}}; dough (as swelling by fermentation); dough, flour.

h1218.definition: from {{h1216}}; a swell of ground; Botscath, a place in Palestine; Bozcath, Boskath.

h1219.definition: a primitive root; to clip off; specifically (as denominative from {{h1210}}); to gather grapes; also to be isolated (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification); cut off, (de-) fenced, fortify, (grape) gather(-er), mighty things, restrain, strong, wall (up), withhold.

h1220.definition: from {{h1219}}; strictly a clipping, i.e. gold (as dug out); gold defence.

h1221.definition: the same as {{h1220}}, an inaccessible spot; Betser, a place in Palestine; also an Israelite; Bezer.

h1223.definition: feminine from {{h1219}}; an enclosure, i.e. sheep fold; Bozrah.

h1224.definition: the same as {{h1223}}; Botsrah, a place in Edom; Bozrah.

h1225.definition: masculine intensive from {{h1219}}; a fortress; stronghold.

h1226.definition: feminine intensive from {{h1219}}; restraint (of rain), i.e. drought; dearth, drought.

h1227.definition: the same as {{h1228}}; Bakbuk, one of the Nethinim; Bakbuk.

h1228.definition: from {{h1238}}; a bottle (from the gurgling in emptying); bottle, cruse.

h1229.definition: from {{h1228}} and {{h3050}}; emptying (i.e. wasting) of Jah; Bakbukjah, an Israelite; Bakbukiah.

h1230.definition: reduplicated from {{h1239}}; searcher; Bakbakkar, an Israelite; Bakbakkar.

h1231.definition: from {{h1238}}; wasteful; Bukki, the name of two Israelites; Bukki.

h1232.definition: from {{h1238}} and {{h3050}}; wasting of Jah; Bukkijah, an Israelite; Bukkiah.

h1234.definition: a primitive root; to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open; make a breach, break forth (into, out, in pieces, through, up), be ready to burst, cleave (asunder), cut out, divide, hatch, rend (asunder), rip up, tear, win.

h1235.definition: from {{h1234}}; a section (half) of a shekel, i.e. a beka (a weight and a coin); bekah, half a shekel.

h1237.definition: from {{h1234}}; properly, a split, i.e. a wide level valley between mountains; plain, valley.

h1238.definition: a primitive root; to pour out, i.e. to empty, figuratively, to depopulate; by analogy, to spread out (as a fruitful vine); (make) empty (out), fail, × utterly, make void.

h1239.definition: a primitive root; properly, to plough, or (generally) break forth, i.e. (figuratively) to inspect, admire, care for, consider; (make) inquire (-ry), (make) search, seek out.

h1241.definition: from {{h1239}}; a beeve or an animal of the ox family of either gender (as used for plowing); collectively, a herd; beeve, bull (  -ock),   calf,   cow, great (cattle),   heifer, herd, kine, ox.

h1242.definition: from {{h1239}}; properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning; ( ) day, early, morning, morrow.

h1243.definition: intensive from {{h1239}}; a looking after; seek out.

h1244.definition: from {{h1239}}; properly, examination, i.e. (by implication) punishment; scourged.

h1245.definition: a primitive root; to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after; ask, beg, beseech, desire, enquire, get, make inquisition, procure, (make) request, require, seek (for).

h1247.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1121}}; a son, grandson, etc.; × old, son.

h1248.definition: borrowed (as a title) from {{h1247}}; the heir (apparent to the throne); son.

h1249.definition: from {{h1305}} (in its various senses); beloved; also pure, empty; choice, clean, clear, pure.

h1250.definition: or בַּר; from {{h1305}} (in the sense of winnowing); grain of any kind (even while standing in the field); by extension the open country; corn, wheat.

h1253.definition: the same as {{h1252}}; vegetable lye (from its cleansing); used as a soap for washing, or a flux for metals; × never so, purely.

h1254.definition: a primitive root; (absolutely) to create; (qualified) to cut down (a wood), select, feed (as formative processes); choose, create (creator), cut down, dispatch, do, make (fat).

h1255.definition: a variation of {{h4757}}; Berodak-Baladan, a Babylonian king; Berodach-baladan.

h1256.definition: from {{h1254}} and {{h8050}}; Jah has created; Berajah, an Israelite; Beraiah.

h1257.definition: by reduplication from {{h1250}}; a fowl (as fattened on grain); fowl.

h1258.definition: a primitive root,; to hail; hail.

h1260.definition: from {{h1258}}; hail; Bered, the name of a place south of Palestine, also of an Israelite; Bered.

h1261.definition: from {{h1258}}; spotted (as if with hail); grisled.

h1262.definition: a primitive root; to select; also (as denominative from {{h1250}}) to feed; also (as equivalent to {{h1305}}) to render clear (Ecclesiastes 3:18); to select; to feed; to render clear; choose, (cause to) eat, manifest, (give) meat.

h1263.definition: passive participle from {{h1288}}; blessed; Baruk, the name of three Israelites; Baruch.

h1264.definition: probably of foreign origin; damask (stuff of variegated thread); rich apparel.

h1265.definition: of uncertain derivation; a cypress (?) tree; hence, a lance or a musical instrument (as made of that wood); fir (tree).

h1266.definition: a variation of {{h1265}}; the cypress (or some elastic tree); fir.

h1268.definition: or בֵּרֹתַי; probably from {{h1266}}; cypress or cypresslike; Berothah or Berothai, a place north of Palestine; Berothah, Berothai.

h1269.definition: probably feminine plural from an unused root (apparently mean to pierce); holes; Birzoth, an Israelite; Birzavith (from the marg.).

h1270.definition: perhaps from the root of {{h1269}}; iron (as cutting); by extension, an iron implement; (ax) head, iron.

h1271.definition: from {{h1270}}; iron-hearted; Barzillai, the name of three Israelites; Barzillai.

h1272.definition: a primitive root; to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly; chase (away); drive away, fain, flee (away), put to flight, make haste, reach, run away, shoot.

h1273.definition: by transposition for {{h978}}; a Barchumite, or native of Bachurim; Barhumite.

h1275.definition: probably by contraction from {{h882}}; Beri, an Israelite; Beri.

h1276.definition: of uncertain derivation; (only in the plural and with the article) the Berites, a place in Palestine; Berites.

h1277.definition: from {{h1254}} (in the sense of {{h1262}}); fatted or plump; fat ((fleshed), -ter), fed, firm, plenteous, rank.

h1278.definition: feminine from {{h1254}}; a creation, i.e. a novelty; new thing.

h1281.definition: or בָּרִחַ; (shortened) from {{h1272}}; a fugitive, i.e. the serpent (as fleeing), and the constellation by that name; crooked, noble, piercing.

h1282.definition: the same as {{h1281}}; Bariach, an Israelite; Bariah.

h1283.definition: apparently from the feminine of {{h7451}} with a prepositional prefix; in trouble; Beriah, the name of four Israelites; Beriah.

h1284.definition: patronymically from {{h1283}}; a Beriite (collectively) or descendants of Beriah; Beerites.

h1285.definition: from {{h1262}} (in the sense of cutting [like {{h1254}}]); a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh); confederacy, (con-) feder(-ate), covenant, league.

h1286.definition: the same as {{h1285}}; Berith, a Shechemitish deity; Berith.

h1288.definition: a primitive root; to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason); × abundantly, × altogether, × at all, blaspheme, bless, congratulate, curse, × greatly, × indeed, kneel (down), praise, salute, × still, thank.

h1292.definition: from {{h1288}} and {{h410}}, God has blessed; Barakel, the father of one of Job's friends; Barachel.

h1293.definition: from {{h1288}}; benediction; by implication prosperity; blessing, liberal, pool, present.

h1294.definition: the same as {{h1293}}; Berakah, the name of an Israelite, and also of a valley in Palestine; Berachah.

h1295.definition: from {{h1288}}; a reservoir (at which camels kneel as a resting-place); (fish-) pool.

h1296.definition: or בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ; from {{h1290}} and {{h3050}}; knee (i.e. blessing) of Jah; Berekjah, the name of six Israelites; Berachiah, Berechiah.

h1297.definition: (Aramaic) perhaps from {{h7313}} with a prepositional prefix; properly, highly, i.e. surely; but used adversatively, however; but, nevertheless, yet.

h1298.definition: of uncertain derivation; Bera, a Sodomitish king; Bera.

h1299.definition: a primitive root; to lighten (lightning); cast forth.

h1300.definition: from {{h1299}}; lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword; bright, glitter(-ing sword), lightning.
